content: Hey hey! I hope y'all are having a great day. I managed to get my first PR merged in the compiler last week and I'm quite proud and I'd like to become way more involved in the future as I've been using and preaching Rust for a while now. I'm a bit lost to be fully honest tho. I stumbled randomly upon for the PR i worked on. Any part of the compiler someone could point me at? The project is so big that it's a bit hard to know where to start
@Lambinoo is there anything in particular you're interested in working on? there are a lot of open issues haha, almost anything will need work

Hi @Lambinoo if you're looking for suggestions, some Rust lang components have a list of "good first issues" up for grab, you can start from there
https://forge.rust-lang.org/#help-wanted

@Joshua Nelson Honestly, that's the main problem. The whole compiler feels interesting and I'm kind of having a Netflix effect where there's a lot of issues, a lot of layers in rustc and picking one is hard :sweat_smile: The only part I touched randomly involved stability markers in rustc_passes so i got to play a bit with the const providers and HIR but that was a stroke of luck to find this one
if you're up for something a little tricky, I would love for this issue to get fixed: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/64762
rustdoc had to implement its own reachability pass because rustc's is broken
you could probably copy some code from visit_ast into rustc and see if that fixes it
Ahah! Here's what I needed. A challenge and someone just taking a decision for me! Let me see what I can do :D
if you get stuck, both I and Vadim Petrochenkov would be good people to ask for help

Well.. Took me almost half a year but it's through x) Funny enough tho, it's still hard to find and jump on a new one x)
Do you have any more "wanted" issue you would like to see handled?
@Lambinoo you can look for issues tagged with E-easy and/or E-mentor
You can also look for E-medium issues, which are—as you might expect—more difficult

Lambinoo said:

Well.. Took me almost half a year but it's through

Well, it's a serious work though, not a trivial fix.
